intro: Dalechampia hastata, commonly known as the arrowleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, spiny capsules that contain its seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
